conclusion: Analyze the process of the ideal gas from state A to B to C using the first law of thermodynamics.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Change in internal energy ΔU for ideal gas: ΔU = nCvΔT.
State A has a temperature of 27°C.
Process from A to B is isothermal (constant temperature).
Temperature from A to B is constant at 300 K.
Work done from A to B: W = nRT ln(VB/VA).
Calculate work done from A to B: W = n × R × 300 ln(2).
Heat transferred from A to B: Q = W since ΔU = 0.
Process from B to C is isobaric (constant pressure).
Pressure from B to C is 1 × 10^5 Pa.
Work done from B to C: W = P(VC - VB).
Calculate work done from B to C: W = 100 J.
Calculate change in temperature from B to C: TC = 450 K.
Change in internal energy from B to C: ΔU = 150nCv.
Heat transferred from B to C: Q = ΔU + W = 150nCv + 100.
Total heat transferred from A to C: Qtotal = QAB + QBC.
Procedure to find total heat transferred involves calculating heat for each segment and summing them.
